The images were published here on Weibo on November 12, 2020. The post has been shared almost 600 times.
The post’s simplified Chinese caption translates to English as: “Goodnight, the Earth. / Aerial night view captured by NASA.”
The images were also published alongside similar claims in 2020 on Weibo here, here and here and on Facebook here, here and here; and in 2015 on Facebook here, on Weibo here and on Twitter here.

A combined reverse image and keyword search found the same images published on the Shutterstock page of Anton Balaz, a Russia-based artist. They can be seen here, here, here, here, here, here, here, here and here.
Below are three sets of comparisons between the misleading Weibo images (L) and the Shutterstock images Anton Balazh (R):
The description on all the images reads: “Elements of this image furnished by NASA”.
In response to the misleading posts, Balaz told AFP that the images are “3D renderings”.

In an Instagram Direct Message on November 22, 2020, Balaz wrote: “All of these images were created in 3D modeling software based on textures provided by NASA for free use. The description of each image, as requested by Shutterstock, states that it is a 3D rendering.”
Similar misleading claims were also debunked by Weibo here and the Chinese state media fjsen.com’s fact-checking team here.
